message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.MM, cs.SY, cs.CR

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper focuses on the medium access control (MAC) layer throughput and resource allocation strategies in millimeter wave (mmWave) communication networks, which are a type of wireless ad hoc networks. 
2. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper derives closed-form expressions for collision probability and MAC layer throughput, which are related to information theory. 
3. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper discusses the use of narrow beam operations in mmWave networks, which can improve the quality of multimedia transmission. 
4. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes a new framework of adaptive hybrid resource allocation procedure, which involves both proactive and reactive phases, and can be seen as a control system. 
5. cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) - Although not the main focus of the paper, the issue of interference management in mmWave networks is related to security and privacy concerns, as unauthorized access to the network can cause interference and disrupt communication.
